summary: "Waiting for Godot" is a play by Irish writer Samuel Beckett. It's about two friends, Vladimir and Estragon, who hang out and chat while waiting for a guy named Godot, but he never shows up. The play is funny and sad at the same time, and it's considered one of the most important English plays of the 20th century. It was first performed in French in 1953 and then in English in 1955.
title: Waiting for Godot
